 PREV PACKAGE   NEXT PACKAGE FRAMES    NO FRAMES    

Package com.jswiff.swfrecords.actions

Class Summary
Action This is the base class for action records.
ActionBlock This class implements a container for action records.
ActionConstants This class contains constants regarding action records.
Add Computes the sum of two numbers.
Add2 This action is used to implement the addition operator according to the ECMAScript specification, i.e. it performs either string concatenation or numeric addition, depending on the data types of the operands.
And Performs a boolean AND (&&) operation.
AsciiToChar Converts an ASCII character code to a character.
BitAnd Performs a bitwise AND (&).
BitLShift Performs a bitwise left shift (<<).
BitOr Performs a bitwise OR (|).
BitRShift Performs a bitwise right shift (>>).
BitURShift Performs a bitwise unsigned right shift (>>>).
BitXor Performs a bitwise XOR (^).
Branch Base class for branch actions (Jump, If).
Call Executes the script attached to a specified frame.
CallFunction Invokes a function, e.g. a user-defined ActionScript function (defined with DefineFunction or DefineFunction2), or a native function, and pushes its result to the stack.
CallMethod Invokes a method and pushes its result to the stack.
CastOp This action allows casting from one data type to another.
CharToAscii Converts a character to its ASCII code.
CloneSprite Duplicates a sprite, creating a new sprite instance at a given depth.
ConstantPool Creates a new constant pool.
Decrement Decrements a number by one.
DefineFunction This action defines a function.
DefineFunction2 This action is used to declare a function.
DefineLocal Defines a local variable and sets its value.
DefineLocal2 Defines a local variable without setting its value.
Delete Deletes an object's property.
Delete2 Destroys an object reference.
Divide Divides two numbers.
EndDrag Ends the drag operation in progress, if any.
Enumerate Iterates over all properties of an object and pushes their names to the stack.
Enumerate2 Iterates over all properties of an object and pushes their names to the stack.
Equals Tests two numbers for equality.
Equals2 Tests two items for equality.
Extends Extends creates an inheritance relationship between two classes (instead of classes, interfaces can also be used, since inheritance between interfaces is also possible).
GetMember Retrieves a member value from an object.
GetProperty Returns the value of a movie property.
GetTime Reports the milliseconds since the SWF started playing.
GetURL Instructs Flash Player to get a specified URL (e.g. an HTML file, an image or another SWF movie) and to display it using a particular target (either a browser frame or a level in Flash Player).
GetURL2 Gets contents from an URL or exchanges data with a server.
GetVariable Gets a variable's value.
GoToFrame Instructs Flash Player to go to the specified frame in the current movie.
GoToFrame2 Instructs Flash Player to go to the specified frame.
GoToLabel Instructs Flash Player to go to a frame associated with the specified label.
Greater Tests whether a number is greater than another number, taking account of data types (according to ECMA-262 spec).
If Evaluates a condition to determine the next action in an SWF file.
ImplementsOp This action specifies the interfaces a class implements.
Increment Increments a number by one.
InitArray Creates an array and initializes it with values from the stack.
InitObject Creates an object and initializes it with values from the stack.
InstanceOf This action determines if an object is an instance of a specified class (or interface as of SWF 7).
Jump Creates an unconditional branch.
Less Tests whether a number is less than another number Performed stack operations:
pop b
pop a
push [a < b] (in SWF 4: 1 if a<b, otherwise 0 - as of SWF 5, true / false)
ActionScript equivalent: < operator
Less2 Tests whether a number is less than another number, taking account of data types (according to ECMA-262 spec).
MBAsciiToChar Converts an ASCII character code to a multibyte character.
MBCharToAscii Converts a multibyte character to its ASCII code.
MBStringExtract Extracts a substring from a string, multibyte-aware.
MBStringLength Computes the length of a string, multibyte-aware.
Modulo Calculates the remainder of the division between two numbers.
MovieProperties This class contains constants used as movie property indexes by GetProperty and SetProperty.
Multiply Computes the product of two numbers.
NewMethod Creates a new object, invoking a constructor.
NewObject Creates a new object, invoking a constructor.
NextFrame Instructs Flash Player to advance to the next frame in the current movie.
Not Performs a boolean NOT (!
Or Performs a boolean OR (||) operation.
Play Instructs Flash Player to start playing at the current frame.
Pop Pops a value from the stack and discards it.
PreviousFrame Instructs Flash Player to go back to the previous frame in the current movie.
Push Pushes one or more values to the stack.
Push.StackValue This class contains a value which can be pushed to the stack.
PushDuplicate Duplicates the value on top of the stack.
RandomNumber Calculates a random non-negative integer less than a specified maximum number.
RemoveSprite Removes a clone sprite created with CloneSprite.
Return Causes the execution to immediately return to the calling function.
SetMember Populates an object's member (either a property or a method) with a given value.
SetProperty Sets the value of a movie property.
SetTarget Instructs Flash Player to change the context of subsequent actions, so they apply to an object with the specified name.
SetTarget2 Instructs Flash Player to change the context of subsequent actions, so they apply to an object with the specified name.
SetVariable Sets a variable.
StackSwap Swaps the top two items on the stack.
StartDrag This action makes the target sprite draggable, i.e. it makes sure users can drag it to another location.
Stop Instructs Flash Player to stop playing at the current frame.
StopSounds This action mutes all sounds currently playing in the movie.
StoreRegister Reads the next item from the stack and stores it in the register with the specified number.
StrictEquals Similar to Equals2, but the two arguments must be of the same type in order to be considered equal (i.e. data types are not converted).
StringAdd Concatenates two strings.
StringEquals Tests two strings for equality.
StringExtract Extracts a substring from a string.
StringGreater Tests whether a string is greater than another.
StringLength Computes the length of a string.
StringLess Tests whether a string is less than another.
Subtract Computes the difference between two numbers.
TargetPath This action returns a string containing the target path of a clip in dot notation.
Throw This action is used to signal an exceptional condition which can be handled by exception handlers declared with Try.
ToggleQuality Toggles the display between high and low quality.
ToInteger Converts an item to an integer.
ToNumber Converts an item into a number.
ToString Converts an item to a string.
Trace Sends a debugging output string to the Output panel of the Macromedia Flash authoring environment (in test mode).
Try This action defines handlers for exceptional conditions (exceptions).
TypeOf This action returns the type of a specified item as a string.
UnknownAction This class implements a placeholder for unknown action records.
WaitForFrame Checks whether the specified frame is loaded.
WaitForFrame2 Checks whether the specified frame is loaded.
With Defines a with action block which lets you specify an object in order to access it's members without having to repeatedly write the object's name or it's path.
